headline: Project Manager at BIA | Leading with Curiosity, Empathy & Product Mindset ü´∂
summary: I‚Äôm a project manager with a product mindset who loves turning ideas into meaningful impact. Over the past few years, my journey has taken me from building startup communities at Buildit VC and Startup Estonia to implementing cross-border innovation programs that support founders and changemakers at Baltic Innovation Agency. Along the way, I‚Äôve learned how to make sense of complex stakeholder needs, use data and research to guide decisions, and stay creative in ambiguity. üí° I‚Äôm endlessly curious and love figuring things out, whether it‚Äôs designing, testing, and launching new ideas, improving how processes work, or experimenting with tools I haven‚Äôt tried yet. I‚Äôm driven by the challenge of making ideas tangible and watching them create value for people. üîé Outside of work, you‚Äôll probably find me catching up on my reading and watch lists, discovering music, or falling down a rabbit hole of something new I‚Äôm learning. üëã Simply send me a quick ‚ÄòHi‚Äô message, and I‚Äôll be glad to chat and exchange thoughts with you.

experience.description: Buildit VC is an early-stage venture fund investing in Industry 4.0 startups across the Nordics and Baltics, helping companies scale from early development to market leadership. At Buildit, I led marketing and communication efforts that strengthened the brand, supported portfolio growth, and connected founders, investors, and the wider innovation community. Highlights: üéØ Built and executed a data-informed content strategy that grew organic web traffic by 20% and social media followers by 15%, enhancing Buildit‚Äôs visibility in the startup ecosystem. üéØ Expanded Buildit Digest ‚Äî the company‚Äôs community newsletter ‚Äî from zero to 800+ engaged subscribers, establishing a new communication channel between portfolio startups and investors. üéØ Applied audience analytics to uncover insights about founder engagement, optimizing outreach campaigns, and driving a 20% increase in re-engagement rates. üéØ Created storytelling-driven campaigns that positioned Buildit as a thought leader in early-stage venture building and strengthened its brand identity across digital platforms. experience.description: At Baltic Innovation Agency (BIA), I help design and deliver large-scale EU-funded innovation projects that foster entrepreneurship and build stronger startup ecosystems across the Nordic-Baltic region. BIA has over 20 years of experience and ‚Ç¨200M+ in secured funding, and I‚Äôm proud to contribute to that legacy by managing projects that empower startups and organizations to turn ideas into tangible impact. What I do: üéØ Lead 8 cross-border innovation projects (IBESI, INFIMO, NOBALIS, BOOST, Spinner, Impact Baltic, ELOBIO, BalticSeaH2) supporting 200+ founders of startups, social enterprises, and NGOs. üéØ Turn complex stakeholder needs into action by coordinating international partners, defining milestones, and ensuring projects stay on track and deliver measurable results. üéØ Use research and data to understand the needs of entrepreneurs and design programs that actually create value and support them. üéØ Build communication strategies that make innovation projects visible and accessible, using storytelling, digital channels, and community engagement to reach target audiences. üéØ Facilitate collaboration between public, private, and academic partners, helping diverse teams stay aligned, motivated, and focused on shared outcomes. üéØ Anticipate and mitigate risks early on, so projects can move fast without losing direction or quality. Show less

Startup Estonia is a government-backed initiative that helps position Estonia as one of the world‚Äôs top hubs for launching and scaling innovative companies. As part of the communications team, I contributed to the growth and visibility of Estonia's thriving startup ecosystem through content creation, storytelling, and community initiatives. Highlights: üéØ Created and managed digital content across LinkedIn, Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter, contributing to an increase in engagement and helping strengthen Startup Estonia‚Äôs online presence. üéØ Produced articles, newsletters, and event coverage that showcased Estonia‚Äôs startup success stories and supported ecosystem visibility. üéØ Created and organized two editions of the ‚ÄúSymbiosis‚Äù reverse pitching event, connecting 21 startup support organizations with early-stage founders, fostering tighter collaboration within the community. üéØ Refined social media strategy based on performance insights, aligning content with audience behavior and emerging ecosystem trends. üéØ Coordinated Startup Estonia‚Äôs participation in key national startup events, ensuring a cohesive brand presence and meaningful engagement with the community. awards.description: Our team won 3rd place in the Tartu Urban Space Hackathon with the idea of a Tinder-like volunteering app where users would "swipe right or swipe left" to find and respond to a call for a local volunteering opportunity. Alternative Finance Roadmap
publications.description: Social enterprises, along with ‚Äútraditional‚Äù SMEs, startups, and Non-Profit Associations (NPAs), often struggle to figure out which funding and financing opportunities are available to them. The absence of a comprehensive, up-to-date database for all opportunities in the Baltic region contributes to this challenge. Discover the "Alternative Finance Roadmap" - your go-to guide for available funding and financing opportunities in the Baltic region. From grants to social impact bonds and beyond, this comprehensive roadmap provides a quick overview of key funding and financing instruments accessible to social enterprises in the Baltic countries. Show less

projects_topics: Redesigning Website and Streamlining Internal Data Collection for the Estonian Health Board (Terviseamet)

projects.name: Redesigning Website and Streamlining Internal Data Collection for the Estonian Health Board (Terviseamet)
projects.description: The Estonian Health Board, or Terviseamet, is a governmental agency under the Ministry of Social Affairs responsible for healthcare, health protection, environmental health, chemical safety, and medical device safety in Estonia. They also provide chargeable laboratory services for assessing water quality. As part of the Digital Product Management Industry Project course of the Delta Sandbox program at the University of Tartu, we collaborated with the Estonian Health Board for a multi-faceted project focused on presenting various stakeholders with access to environmental health data for personal awareness and research purposes in an efficient, user-friendly, and interactive way as well as updating and modernizing internal data collection from business clients. To address the challenge of accessibility, fragmentation, and lack of awareness about environmental health data, we prototyped a possible redesign of the current website to make it more interactive, user-friendly, and integrated with all the background business-related processes. On the other hand, we also tackled the issue of the time-consuming and error-prone manual data entry process that causes delays in data availability. Our team developed business process maps for both water quality and mobile operator areas of the Estonian Health Board, which included pointers to improve the speed of internal business processes that slow down data entry and collection. Show less
